description: Numbers n such that 3*10^n - 1 is prime.
comments: Also numbers n such that 2*10^n + 9*R_n is prime, where R_n = 11...1 is the repunit (A002275) of length n.
links: Makoto Kamada, Prime numbers of the form 299...99.
Index entries for primes involving repunits
mathematica: Do[ If[ PrimeQ[ 2*10^n + (10^n-1)], Print[n]], {n, 0, 3000}]Select[Range[200000],PrimeQ[3*10^#-1]&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 29 2012 *)
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2000
extensions: More terms from Herman Jamke (hermanjamke(AT)fastmail.fm), Jan 01 2008
